snippet: The company’s Ethicon unit, responding to safety concerns, asked that hospitals return three models of power morcellators, which are used to remove fibroids.
abstract: Johnson & Johnson wins cautious praise from critics after withdrawing three products used in uterine surgery because of risk of spreading cancerous tissue, only months after safety issue became widely known; decision follows withering criticism for its response to problems with medical devices in past.
lead_paragraph: The company’s Ethicon unit, responding to safety concerns, asked that hospitals return three models of power morcellators, which are used to remove fibroids.

headline.main: Johnson & Johnson Praised for Taking Uterine Surgery Tools Off Market
headline.print_headline: Johnson & Johnson Praised for Taking Uterine Surgery Tools Off Market
